item.title: Report I-2024090065
item.description:
Report I-2024090065

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-30T09:14:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-28
  • City: orlando
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: DELTA AIR LINES, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 08/28/2024, during cruise phase of flight DL 1570 (BOS-MCO), a passenger's laptop was observed to be smoking. Water and a fire containment bag was used to mitigate the release. The flight continued to destination without further incident. No flight crew or customer injuries were reported. The NRC and FM were notified.

item.title: Report E-2024100615
item.description:
Report E-2024100615

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-27T18:24:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-17
  • City: LAKELAND
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 17, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of resin was damaged by a forklift and released approximately 20-gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the UN1866-impacted roadway and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum, the damaged 55-gallon drum was placed into one (1) 85-gallon overpack for transport and disposal.
